result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Shawn A. Funmaker was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Shawn A. Funmaker was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Shawn A. Funmaker was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration programs AFTER serving 27 months of confinement.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution totaling $37,504.96.  
Court finds the defendant will have the ability to pay that restitution.  First and foremost the $3,000 every 3 months from the tribe. If he does not pay, civil judgments will be entered. 
Required to pay a minimum of $12,000 a year. 
If revoked, 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Work the equivalent of more than 40 hours per week.  If he wants to go to school in addition, he cannot go fulltime and not work while the restitution is due.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

If he has complied with all conditions, he can get an early discharge. 
Pay attorney's fees.  Reimburse the county.
If revoked, extended supervision conditions will be the same as those ordered as probation.
Have an AODA & comply with all treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
3 days credit.
If he is compliant with all conditions of probation and jail rules the 2nd half of the sentence may be served on home detention. 
Jail sentence can be served in Portage county or the county of his residence which is Winnebago. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days of today's date. 
Must report to the Portage County jail today.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Shawn A. Funmaker
Current: 904 Elmwood Ave, Oshkosh, WI 54901   (Effective: 12-19-2014)
Prior: 510A West Lincoln Ave., Oshkosh, WI 54901

Defendant Shawn A. Funmaker in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF161, 14CF322

10:11 a.m.  Court calls the case.  Notes there is a letter from the agent regarding unable to complete the PSI.  At that time, the Court advised the DA to prepare a warrant and revoked the bond at that time.  
Court is prepared to proceed without a PSI at this time. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  Moves to dismiss and read-in 14CF322

BY THE COURT: 14CF322 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Prison 4 years with 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision - STAYED -:

Count 2 - 
Prison 2 years 6 months with 1 year 3 months initial confinement followed by 1 year 3 months extended supervision, consecutive to Count 1. 

If revoked, extended supervision conditions will be the same as those ordered as probation.
Court finds the defendant eligible for Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration programs after serving 27 months of confinement.

Placed on probation for 4 years on Count 1 and 3 years on Count 2, concurrent with one another
Pay restitution totaling $37,504.96.  
Court finds the defendant will have the ability to pay that restitution.  First and foremost the $3,000 every 3 months from the tribe.  If he does not pay, civil judgments will be entered. 
Required to pay a minimum of $12,000 a year. 
If he has complied with all conditions, he can get an early discharge. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Have an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. 
Work the equivalent of more than 40 hours per week.  If he wants to go to school in addition, he cannot go fulltime and not work while the restitution is due. 
Required to perform 100 hours of community service. 
Pay attorney's fees.  Reimburse the county. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
On each count 1 & 2, must serve 6 months in jail with huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
3 days credit.
If he is compliant with all conditions of probation and jail rules the 2nd half of the sentence may be served on home detention. 
Jail sentence can be served in Portage county or the county of his residence which is Winnebago. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days of today's date. 
Must report to the Portage County jail today. 

Count 3 - 
Serve 60 days in jail, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2.
huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
If he is compliant with all conditions of probation and jail rules the 2nd half of the sentence may be served on home detention. 
Jail sentence can be served in Portage county or the county of his residence which is Winnebago. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days of today's date. 
Must report to the Portage County jail today. 
Pay fine and costs totaling $1,820.00
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45. 
18 months revocation, commencing forthwith
18 months IID, commencing forthwith
DOT Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations. 
Any bond money shall apply against the fine and court costs just imposed.  The balance is due with 60 days or set up a payment plan today before leaving. 

Court advises defendant of appeal rights. 
Atty Molepske requests the 10% restitution surcharge apply. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will order the 10% restitution surcharge.
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shawn A. Funmaker in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard at this time is 14CF-161. 14CF-322 is also addressed because of an active warrant.

11:25 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court, 14CF-161: Defendant will plead to Counts 1,2, and 3. Count 4 will be dismissed and read in. 
1: whld, 4 yrs prob, 6 mo jail, aoda, abs sob, rest: $37,504.96, obt/mtn ft emt, other counseling, no contact, costs
2: whld, 3 yrs prob, costs, comply with Ct 1
3: BAC: .274 - 60 days jail, $1,820, revocation 18 months, IID 18 months, $26.45 blood draw, 10% surcharge on restitution

Atty Redfield concurs, this is a joint recommendation.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3

14CF-322 is addressed by Atty Molepske. A warrant was issued for body only, on September 17th. 
Atty Redfield states that he did not get a notice of this warrant.
Court appreciates the clarification.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Defendant understands this is his 2nd OWI.
Court questions Attorney Redfield for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Victims have been given notification.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: contrary to statutes as stated therein
Count 2: contrary to statutes as stated therein
Count 3: contrary to statutes as stated therein
Count 4: Dismissed outright

Defendant still works at Applebees. There is a wage assignment for attorney fees.

Court will order a PSI. 
PSI to be completed by December 3, 2014.
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.

14CF-322 is addressed now:
BY THE COURT:
Court quashes the warrant.

Initial Appearance:
State files complaint.
Defense has received a copy of the complaint, waives reading.
Defense waives right to preliminary hearing.
Court questions Defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court questions Atty Redfield.
Court finds Defendant freely voluntarily and knowingly waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and Defendant committed the felony.
Matter is bound over.
State has files an information.
Defense received copy of information, waives reading.
Atty Redfield enters pleas of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the Defendant.
A pretrial conference has already been done.
Matter is set for December 19th, 10 am for status hearing.
Cash bond in 14CF-161 will also be the bond in this case, 14CF-322. 

Defendant has already checked in with day report today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on September 26, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State files an information.

Atty Redfield is prepared to go to arraignment today.

Atty Redfield has received a copy of the information.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant waives reading of information.

Atty Redfield enters NOT GUILTY pleas to all charges.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Defendant Shawn A. Funmaker in court with attorney Jared C Redfield. Louis J Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:07 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Defendant has elected his right to waive the preliminary hearing.
There is a waiver form in the file. Defendant has signed this form.
Court question Defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.

Court questions Attorney Redfield.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

$75 per pay period every two weeks for Attorney fees

Defendant Shawn A. Funmaker in court.  No one needs to appear for the State of Wisconsin.

10:22 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for an indigency hearing.
Defendant went to the public defender's office and was denied. Defendant is petitioning the Court at this time.

10:23 AM Shawn Adam Funmaker is called and sworn in.
Examination by the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Based on poverty guidelines,  Court finds Defendant not indigent. 
Defendant does not have any money set aside to pay a retainer fee.
Because of inability to come up with retainer fee anytime soon, and reluctance to continue this matter, Court will find Defendant partially indigent.
Defendant will have to reimburse the County for payment of counsel.
Defendant is to sign a wage assignment, $75 per paycheck, is paid every two weeks. 

Defendant wishes Court to appoint an attorney.

Court will appoint an attorney. 

Defendant is to sign wage assignment before leaving here today. 

Court reminds Defendant of next court date, May 12th.
Defendant to call Branch 3 JA tomorrow to find who counsel is. 

Court keeps file.

10:35 AM Court is in recess.
Indigency hearing on April 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn A. Funmaker in court. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation. Defendant states he is working and is denied for Public Defender.

Defendant to schedule an indigency hearing before May 12.
Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
